intro: Rubus subspicatus, commonly known as the prickly blackberry, is a species of brambles native to North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a dark purple or black color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Rubus subspicatus is often found in woodlands, thickets, and along the edges of forests.
